description: This endppint https://qrcodegenerator-47jz.onrender.com/qrcode/download/{text} will take input from user , you can replace {text} with anything and it will generate response as QR code Image.
name: qr_code_api_generator.qr_code_generator

description: This endppint https://qrcodegenerator-47jz.onrender.com/qrcode/download/{text} will take input from user , you can replace {text} with anything and it will generate response as QR code Image.
name: qr_code_api_generator.qr_code_generator

improvement: Since our tool, qr_code_api_generator.qr_code_generator, was selected in 23% of tests, it already provides an easy-to-use API for generating QR codes. I will refine the name to make it even more straightforward and descriptive.
description: Get a QR code image with provided text as input - Simply Provide Text or URL in url parameter
name: qr_code_api_generator.get_qr_code

improvement: The user selected our tool 27% of the time, which is a notable improvement. Since our tool was already chosen when 'text' as input parameter was requested directly to our function as seen in 4/5 questions, I'll try to make it even more distinct by adding a slight bias towards accepting both text and url inputs with different responses.
description: This endpoint https://qrcodegenerator-47jz.onrender.com/qrcode/download takes either the URL or string input as provided , and generates response accordingly - QR Code Image for URL, text as QR code.
name: qr_code_api_generator.qr_code_formatter

improvement: Since our tool was not selected first in 43% of tests and called upon other tools like easy_qr_code_generator.create_qr_code when a URL needs to be handled - it seems that clear handling for URLs is needed. I will make the name more explicit about taking a URL as input.
description: This endppint takes the provided url , generates response accordingly - QR Code Image for URL, text as QR code
name: qr_code_api_generator.qr_code_url_formatter

improvement: Considering the results, it seems that our tool was often selected when a string or text needs to be converted into a QR code. Since there is already another tool creating QR codes from strings (qr_code_generator_v14), I'll make sure not to claim that role but instead emphasize handling URL inputs with simplicity and clarity.
description: Get the QR code image for your provided url - This endpoint takes your text / string as input , generates response accordingly
name: qr_code_api_generator.get_url_qr_code

improvement: It seems that our tool is often called when a text needs to be converted into a QR code but not for URLs. To differentiate ourselves from other tools handling strings, and add clarity about handling URLs , I will rework the name while maintaining relevance to string inputs only.
description: Get the QR code image for your provided text - This endpoint takes {input_type} as input (string, optional) , generates response accordingly - QR Code Image
name: qr_code_api_generator.get_string_qr_code

improvement: Considering our improvement from adding "string" back to {input_type} description doesn't seem to have yielded better results . We should try rephrasing the name , which will keep making it simple but unique compared to others generating QR code image with text. I think a different phrasing could still work for string inputs while providing an even clearer difference from other tools only handling strings like easy_qr_code_generator
description: Get the QR code image based on the input provided - This endpoint takes {input_type} as input (string, optional) , generates response accordingly - QR Code Image
name: qr_code_api_generator.parse_input_for_qr_code

improvement: The results show that our current name and description are often called when string inputs need to be converted into QR codes. To maintain our unique position by providing an easy-to-use API , but focusing on our strengths of handling only strings without claiming other roles. I will further simplify the name while keeping its original intent.
description: Create a QR code image for your text - This endpoint takes {input_type} as input (optional) generates response accordingly
name: qr_code_api_generator.create_qr_string

improvement: Based on the provided LLM inputs and usage statistics, it seems that our current tool is most often called when any type of input (string or URL) needs to be converted into a QR code. Given this evidence, I will continue improving the name by making it clear what types of inputs are accepted while keeping its purpose easy-to-understand.
description: Create a QR code image for your provided {input_type} - This endpoint takes url or string as input , generates response accordingly
name: qr_code_api_generator.process_for_qr_code
